result.execSummary:
The defendant Juan L. Walker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Juan L. Walker in court with attorney Debra V. O'Rourke.  Kevin R. Calkins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty O'Rourke states matter is resolved and states recs.  State agrees and moves to amend.  Court amends to Misd. THC and Atty O'Rourke enters NC plea.  DE agrees.  Court questions DE on plea/accepts/finds guilty and sentences.

Ct 1:  NC - amended to Misd. THC
20 days jail w/huber consecutive to any other sentence
4 days sentence credit to be applied
To commence on or before 11/30/2014 at 6:00 pm
Costs of $563.25 to be paid w/in 60 days or set up payment plan

Pre-trial conference on November 7, 2014 at 11:00 am.
Return date on November 19, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Juan L. Walker appeared by video means from LEC w/atty. Deb ORourke. Prosecuting Atty Sue Mueller appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  DE does qualify for PD representation.  State requests $500.00 cash bond.   Atty. ORourke makes bail argument and requests PA bond.  Advised rights to an attorney.  Requests Preliminary hearing; Time limits waived.  $500.00 Signature bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows: Absoulte Sobriety of alcohol and controlled substances w/o valid prescription  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 7, 2014 at 11:00 am.  Return date scheduled for November 19, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
